OriginalText.Contents: DATE: 2010-03-18 COUNTRY: SRI LANKA (LK) TOPIC: DISSENT; GOVERNMENT; POLITICS SUMMARY: ON MARCH 18, 2010 SRI LANKAN MEDIA GROUPS PROTESTED AGAINST THE ARREST OF A REPORTER CLOSE TO SARATH FONSEKA NAMED RUWAN WEERAKOON. SARATH FONSEKA'S TRIAL ALSO OCCURRED IN MARCH 2010. BODY: 1. ON MARCH 18, 2010 SRI LANKAN MEDIA GROUPS PROTESTED AGAINST THE ARREST OF A REPORTER CLOSE TO SARATH FONSEKA NAMED RUWAN WEERAKOON. A. RUWAN WEERAKOON IS A REPORTER WITH THE NATION NEWSPAPER. B. RUWAN WEERAKOON WAS ARRESTED THE WEEK OF MARCH 11, 2010. 2. SARATH FONSEKA IS THE DETAINED EX-ARMY CHIEF WHO LOST TO MAHINA RAJAPAKSA IN THE SRI LANKAN PRESIDENTIAL ELECTION ON JANUARY 26, 2010. A. SARATH FONSEKA ALSO LED THE SRI LANKAN MILITARY DURING THE FINAL PHASE OF THE 2009 WAR AGAINST THE TAMIL TIGER REBELS. B. SARATH FONSEKA WAS AN ALLY OF PRESIDENT MAHINDA RAJAPAKSE WHEN THE TAMIL TIGERS WERE CRUSHED IN MAY 2009 BUT THE 2 MEN BECAME RIVALS AFTER CONTESTING THE PRESIDENCY IN THE ELECTION IN JANUARY 2010. C. SARATH FONSEKA IS A MEMBER OF THE DEMOCRATIC NATIONAL ALLIANCE PARTY. D. SARATH FONSEKA LOST THE PRESIDENTIAL ELECTION ON JANUARY 26, 2010 BY 1.8 MILLION VOTES. E. SARATH FONSEKA IS SRI LANKA’S FIRST 4 STAR GENERAL AND WAS IN THE ARMY FOR OVER 40 YEARS. 3 . SARATH FONSEKA WAS ARRESTED ON FEBRUARY 8, 2010 ON THE CHARGE OF PLANNING A MILITARY COUP WHILE IN UNIFORM. A. SARATH FONSEKA APPEARED IN FRONT OF A COURT MARTIAL THE WEEK OF MARCH 18, 2010. THE CASE WAS ADJOURNED. B. SRI LANKAN RETIRED CHIEF JUSTICE SARATH SILVA CRITICIZED THE TREATMENT OF SARATH FONSEKA AND STATED THAT THERE IS NO DEMOCRACY IN SRI LANKA BECAUSE THERE IS NO ROOM FOR DISSENT. C. SOON AFTER SARATH FONSEKA’S ARREST 15 HIGH RANKING ARMY OFFICERS CONSIDERED TO SUPPORT SARATH FONSEKA WERE SENT ON COMPULSORY RETIREMENT. 4. LOCAL AND INTERNATIONAL RIGHTS GROUPS HAVE ACCUSED MAHINDA RAJAPAKSE OF CRACKING DOWN ON DISSENT BUT THE SRI LANKAN GOVERNMENT DENIES THE ACCUSATION. 5. THE TAMIL TIGERS ARE ALSO CALLED THE LIBERATION TIGERS OF TAMIL EELAM. A. THE TAMIL TIGERS HAVE FOUGHT FOR 37 YEARS IN A SEPARATIST STRUGGLE THAT LED TO 100000 DEATHS.

Region.Contents: date: 2010-03-18 country: sri lanka (lk) topic: dissent; government; politics summary: on march 18, 2010 sri lankan media groups protested against the arrest of a reporter close to sarath fonseka named ruwan weerakoon. sarath fonseka's trial also occurred in march 2010. body: 1. on march 18, 2010 sri lankan media groups protested against the arrest of a reporter close to sarath fonseka named ruwan weerakoon. a. ruwan weerakoon is a reporter with the nation newspaper. b. ruwan weerakoon was arrested the week of march 11, 2010. 2. sarath fonseka is the detained ex-army chief who lost to mahina rajapaksa in the sri lankan presidential election on january 26, 2010. a. sarath fonseka also led the sri lankan military during the final phase of the 2009 war against the tamil tiger rebels. b. sarath fonseka was an ally of president mahinda rajapakse when the tamil tigers were crushed in may 2009 but the 2 men became rivals after contesting the presidency in the election in january 2010. c. sarath fonseka is a member of the democratic national alliance party. d. sarath fonseka lost the presidential election on january 26, 2010 by 1.8 million votes. e. sarath fonseka is sri lanka’s first 4 star general and was in the army for over 40 years. 3 . sarath fonseka was arrested on february 8, 2010 on the charge of planning a military coup while in uniform. a. sarath fonseka appeared in front of a court martial the week of march 18, 2010. the case was adjourned. b. sri lankan retired chief justice sarath silva criticized the treatment of sarath fonseka and stated that there is no democracy in sri lanka because there is no room for dissent. c. soon after sarath fonseka’s arrest 15 high ranking army officers considered to support sarath fonseka were sent on compulsory retirement. 4. local and international rights groups have accused mahinda rajapakse of cracking down on dissent but the sri lankan government denies the accusation. 5. the tamil tigers are also called the liberation tigers of tamil eelam. a. the tamil tigers have fought for 37 years in a separatist struggle that led to 100000 deaths.
